title: RuntimeError: dim() called on undefined Tensor
body_html:
Reported here in a different form: https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/runtimeerror-contiguous-is-not-implemented-for-type-undefinedtype/11124/30 .

Took me a while to isolate the bug but below is a script to reproduce this:

import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable
from torch.autograd import Function

class Fn(Function):
    def forward(self, x, y):
        return torch.zeros(2, 2, 2)

    def backward(self, grad_output):
        return torch.zeros(2, 2, 2), None

x = Variable(torch.zeros(1), requires_grad=True)
y = x[0].expand(2000, 5)
model = Fn()
model(x, y).sum().backward()

I'm looking into it.

body:
Reported here in a different form: https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/runtimeerror-contiguous-is-not-implemented-for-type-undefinedtype/11124/30 .

Took me a while to isolate the bug but below is a script to reproduce this:
```
import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable
from torch.autograd import Function

class Fn(Function):
    def forward(self, x, y):
        return torch.zeros(2, 2, 2)

    def backward(self, grad_output):
        return torch.zeros(2, 2, 2), None

x = Variable(torch.zeros(1), requires_grad=True)
y = x[0].expand(2000, 5)
model = Fn()
model(x, y).sum().backward()
```
I'm looking into it.
